text: <@U0S5KF44D> what kind of DB is currently being used for user info ?
CFSSL supports mysql, postgres, and sqllite.   See <https://github.com/cloudflare/cfssl/tree/master/certdb>

attachments.title: cloudflare/cfssl
attachments.text: cfssl - CFSSL: CloudFlare's PKI and TLS toolkit

text: <@U1CTBUNEN>: by `currently`, you mean v0.5, v0.6, master?

The integration of the CFSSL (toolkit) is in the making… and will indeed provide a much richer set of customizability - but the above are the DBs used for storing the signed certificates.

While one may or may not relate to `certs` as `user info`, you should know that in addition to the certs that the CFSSL toolkit can store (potentially/in the future, when it is integrated in Fabric), currently: Membership Services stores much more info about users/enrollment… and these are all stored in the local sqllite file (which we sometimes refer to as the ‘server's state’).

Hope this helps.
